channel.title: Free Music
channel.description:
If you're tired of using torrents/limewire, and having to deal with slow speed and a possibility of an infection, I found a way to solve this.
1. First of all, download firefox, that is the only way to use this.
2. After firefox is setup, download this addon.
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/3006
3. When it is done, go to playlist.com, and play the song that you want for free.
4. Then click on this button- [img]http://i35.tinypic.com/k0ivj4.png[/img]
5. When the menu like this appears-
[img]http://i33.tinypic.com/fm1hxu.png[/img]
Just click on the second button, and save it where you want, and you're done!
Virus free and it downloads extrememly fast.

item.title: Free Music
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:30, topic:241683”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=318041.msg2552834#msg2552834 date=1227719796]

bits = bytes / 8

So yeah, 2 megabits = 0.25 megabytes.

bits = bytes * 8
[/quote]
0.25*8 is 2
As previously stated 8 bits to a byte[/quote]

His formula is wrong. bits=bytes/8 would give: 8 bits = x/8, x=64.
bits=bytes8 would give: 8 bits = x8, x = 1

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:25, topic:241683”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=318041.msg2551941#msg2551941 date=1227636768]
Hardly anyone downloads at the speed they are supposed to get though.
[/quote]
true im promised 5mb but no such luck[/quote]
The way you calculated it was 2megabytes, in fact internet is usually advertised as megabit, I have 2mb connection. Meaning most I could download would be about 500-600gb

(2megabit = 0.25megabytes)

(I think thats how it goes, correct me if I’m wrong)

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:22, topic:241683”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=318041.msg2542943#msg2542943 date=1227108720]

i get free internet, and unlimited usage (upto 100Terrabytes)

thats not unlimited then
[/quote]
I am pretty sure most ISP’s at advertise as “Unlimited usage” are actually capped, but at extremely high values. Just got to read the small print. Plus the fact at internet speeds these days (2mb/s) it wouldn’t be possible to get higher than around 500gb or so.[/quote]
2mb/s
120 per minute
7200 per hour
172800 per day
1209600 per week
4838400 in feburary
5184000 in 30 days
5356800 in 31 days
Summary
7.2GB per hour
172.8GB per day
1.2096TB per week
4.8364TB per month(februry)
5.184TB per month(30)
5.3568TB per month(31)
Thats assuming constant downloading and a constant speed of 2mb/s

Read full topic

item.title: Free Music
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:20, topic:241683”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=318041.msg2539654#msg2539654 date=1226942405]
i get free internet, and unlimited usage (upto 100Terrabytes)
[/quote]
thats not unlimited then[/quote]
I am pretty sure most ISP’s at advertise as “Unlimited usage” are actually capped, but at extremely high values. Just got to read the small print. Plus the fact at internet speeds these days (2mb/s) it wouldn’t be possible to get higher than around 500gb or so.

Read full topic

@Ollie: My speed suits me, I live in NZ. So, that is the fastest connection we can get… And it is like $40 a month. + No limit to downloads.
